conversion_verification.notes: All mandatory 3D conversion verification checks passed.

3d_conversion_fundamentals.notes: Walls have height and thickness, floors are distinct from walls, interior volume is perceivable. Proper 3D wall corner geometry is mostly present. Clean cutaway with interior visible, though some minor geometry issues exist at the balcony rail. Viewing angle is good.

geometric_accuracy.notes: Correct number of rooms and adjacency relationships are maintained. Relative room proportions are good. Major wall positions align well, and lengths are proportional. Internal partitions are mostly correct. Doors are present and on correct walls, but some windows are missing or poorly represented.

interior_elements.notes: Major furniture is present in correct rooms. Kitchen and bathroom fixtures are present. Furniture scale is reasonable and orientation is logical.

visual_clarity.notes: Walls, floors, and openings are clearly distinguishable. Geometry is readable. Interior is visible with adequate lighting. Consistent material usage. Minor rendering issue with text from the original floor plan being 'baked' into the 3D model, which detracts from presentation.

detected_errors.description: Some windows from the original 2D plan are either missing in the 3D model or not accurately represented.
Text labels from the 2D floor plan are present in the 3D render, detracting from the aesthetic and visual clarity.
Small geometry issue at the balcony railing where it meets the wall, not perfectly seamless.

summary: The 2D to 3D conversion is good, accurately transforming the floor plan into an isometric 3D render with most geometric and interior details preserved, though minor issues exist with window representation and embedded text from the source material.
